item.title:
A new brain-inspired neural network system improves the ability of robots in recognition of places such as forests and indoor corridors—and it does so with 43.6% less power consumption than common mobile robot processors.

item.description:

item.content:encoded: What triggers anorexia nervosa? We find that chronic stress can trigger willful seeking of a starvation-like state in mice. As in humans, this was enriched in female mice, particularly those predisposed to stress. https://t.co/ZctjCgwQYD 1/7 https://t.co/6TPYouEmoc

item.title: Elevated anxiety often precedes anorexia nervosa. Patients with anorexia nervosa often describe hunger as pleasant, potentially because food restriction can be anxiolytic. We tested whether chronic stress can cause animals to prefer a starvation-like state. 2/7

item.description: @blamlab 30% difference in a heavily confounded setting does not strongly convince me of causality. But it is large enough that follow ups are interesting. The temporal trend is the main argument- but arguably there have been other trends.

item.title: Every 4 to 10 years, certain oak populations will synchronize to produce almost no acorns at all (starving off mammals), only to rain them down excessively the following year. item.title: @KordingLab @blamlab Indeed, hazard ratio decreases from 30 to 2.3 when adjusting for confounds. I don't have THAT much trust in statistical models. Re trend, how could the proportion attributable to cannabis use disorder grow so much (4 fold since 1990) if the hazard ratio itself does not grow?

item.title:
@KordingLab @blamlab I actually buy the causal link... based on personal anecdotal experience.
But, based on that same anecdotal data, I think it is almost surely the case that cannabis only accelerates and exacerbates the situation for those who are already at risk for schizophrenia anyway.
